events.name: Betwixt Festival Sunday Showcase: Art & Bytes
events.description:
Admission is free of charge to this 3 day special edition of Sunday Showcase -part of the Betwixt Festival
http://2016.betwixtfestival.com/ #betwixtfestivalsg

The festival showcase features: an art exhibition which will feature a work by Austrian artist LIA, who is considered one of the pioneers of software and net art; 6 works from an Open Call which attracted over 170 submissions from different parts of the world; 3 works from students from Ping Yi Secondary School which participated in a pilot workshop programme supported by NAC, Fun with Art & Bytes, and film screenings of Lillian Schwartz, her life and her works. 

Screenings of Lillian Schwartz documentaries:
- 26 February 2016, 1-2pm

P.P.M. [PUZZLED.PROCESSED.MESHED.] by Otto Krause and Milan Lovi≈°ka with Alwyn Burger and Jason Nel:
-26 February 2016, 2.30-3pm
Using trampolines as nonsensical game controllers or full-body game pads, the artists transform the exhaustive activity of jumping into unexpected virtual representations and digital interactions.

events.name: EML Plugin Session 2016
events.description:
Electronic Music Lab open its doors so that you can see what we've been cooking up! Come party with the #emlfamily at EML Plugin on 26th Feb.

EML Plugin is an open-mic style event, built specially for budding electronic producers to showcase their latest creations. Catch our Ableton Workshop attendees as they preview their WIPs (Work in Progress), or just hang out and share your favorite earworms together.

The only requirement is to bring your own food to our Potluck BBQ. The event is free, but we do need donations to keep this alive. Support the movement with our EML shirts, stickers and wristbands on sale!

events.name: TGIFHacks #47 - Particle Photon
events.description:
This week's TGIFHacks will be on Particle Photon, one of the coolest and newest Internet of Things (IoT) device.

Internet of Things is a description of physical objects embedded with electronics (usually able to communicate with one another). Head over to this weeks TGIFHacks to learn more about what IoT is and also get some hands on experience with Particle Photon! You will see how easy it is to build you own IoT protoype in less than a minute with smart devices like the Photon. Also, learn about how the Photon compares with other smart boards in the market!

Key Takeaways:
Learn about IoT and Particle Photon
Things you can do with the Particle Photon
Learn how to build you own IoT prototype under a minute
Introduction to Particle's cloud API and use of IFTTT
